verbs.description: [ARGM-LOC: In a surprising overture to China] , [ARG0: President Donald Trump] [V: says] [ARG1: he would help a Chinese telecommunications company get " back into business] , " [ARGM-ADV: saying too many jobs in China are at stake after the U.S. government cut off access to its American suppliers] .

In a surprising overture to China , President Donald Trump says he [V: would] help a Chinese telecommunications company get " back into business , " saying too many jobs in China are at stake after the U.S. government cut off access to its American suppliers .

In a surprising overture to China , President Donald Trump says [ARG0: he] [ARGM-MOD: would] [V: help] [ARG1: a Chinese telecommunications company get " back into business] , " saying too many jobs in China are at stake after the U.S. government cut off access to its American suppliers .

In a surprising overture to China , President Donald Trump says he would help [ARG1: a Chinese telecommunications company] [V: get] " [ARG2: back into business] , " saying too many jobs in China are at stake after the U.S. government cut off access to its American suppliers .

In a surprising overture to China , [ARG0: President Donald Trump] says he would help a Chinese telecommunications company get " back into business , " [V: saying] [ARG1: too many jobs in China are at stake after the U.S. government cut off access to its American suppliers] .

In a surprising overture to China , President Donald Trump says he would help a Chinese telecommunications company get " back into business , " saying [ARG1: too many jobs in China] [V: are] [ARG2: at stake] [ARGM-TMP: after the U.S. government cut off access to its American suppliers] .
